page.title: 07OUR VILLAGE MUSEUM, HENFIELD
page.content: Our Museum shows the local history of our village. It is all housed in a small room in the Village Hall. When I visited this museum it was a Saturday morning. It was not very busy which was a pity. Much on display was connected with agriculture and village life. I saw a clay pipe. There was a horse gag which was used to depress the horse's tongue so medicine could be given - it looked cruel. There were sheep shears and a Bowman's saw. One display showed a stained glass window made in Sussex. I liked a wax doll dated 1760. It wore a long dress and a necklace and had a straw hat. There was also a model of a broad-wheeled Sussex wagon. There were also some signs from the old railway station closed by Dr. Beechins. There is plenty to see and displays are changed quite regularly.
